intro: Roella alpina, commonly known as the alpine roella, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Arctic and alpine zones. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early summer, and it produces small, round seed pods. Roella alpina is often found in tundra and mountainous regions where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
